title: Englishpod 初级 英文播客 0003

segments.en: Hello, English learners, and welcome to EnglishPod.

segments.en: My name is Marco.
I'm Amira.

segments.cn: Amira和我今天在这里进行一个关于酒店情况的有趣课程。

segments.en: Amira, why don't you give us a little bit more information?
segments.cn: Amira，你能多给我们一些信息吗？

segments.en: Well, the situation is taking place in a hotel and someone is checking in and is obtaining an upgrade.
segments.cn: 好吧，情况发生在一家酒店，有人正在办理入住并获得升级。

segments.en: Good afternoon.
What can I do for you?
I'd like to check in, please.
I have a reservation under the name Anthony Roberts.

segments.en: All right.
Roberts.
Oh, Mr. Roberts, we've been expecting you.
segments.cn: 哦，Roberts先生，我们一直在等您。

segments.en: And here is your key card to the presidential suite.

segments.en: But there must be some mistake.

Are you sure?
Let me double check.
Yeah, here.

You're right, Mr. Roberts.

segments.en: So?
Not to worry.
We're pleased to offer you a complimentary upgrade.

segments.en: Whoo-hoo!
Presidential suite, baby!
Okay, everyone.
That is nice, huh?

segments.en: Yes, there's some interesting phrases and vocabulary items here.
segments.cn: 是的，这里有一些有趣的短语和词汇。

segments.en: And I know, Marco, you want to talk about some of them.
segments.cn: 我知道，Marco，你想谈谈其中的一些。

segments.en: Right.
The first one, and this is really useful for all of our listeners who travel a lot, this phrase will come in handy.
segments.cn: 第一个，这对我们所有经常旅行的听众非常有用，这个短语会派上用场。

segments.en: And it is I have a reservation under the name.
segments.cn: 它是“我有一个以……名字的预订”。

segments.en: Under the name.
Under the name.
Under the name.
So before we explain this phrase, let's listen to some examples on how it is used in other situations, and then we'll come back and give you more information.
segments.cn: 在我们解释这个短语之前，让我们听一些在其他情况下如何使用的例子，然后再回来给您更多信息。

segments.en: My secretary made a reservation under my name.
segments.cn: 我的秘书以我的名字做了一个预订。

segments.en: I'm sorry, sir.
I don't have a reservation under that name.
segments.cn: 我没有以那个名字的预订。

segments.en: Do you have a reservation under the name Smith?
segments.cn: 您有以Smith的名字的预订吗？

segments.en: All right, some really good examples there on how we could use this phrase in other situations.
segments.cn: 好吧，这里有一些很好的例子，说明我们如何在其他情况下使用这个短语。

segments.en: But just in case, let me explain it real fast.
segments.cn: 但以防万一，让我快速解释一下。

segments.en: Under the name means that when you go to the restaurant or a hotel, and you tell them your name, they know that you are the person that they have been expecting.
segments.cn: 以……名字意味着当你去餐厅或酒店时，你告诉他们你的名字，他们知道你就是他们一直在等的人。

segments.en: They have been waiting.
Yes.
Well, I have chosen another useful phrase for you.
segments.cn: 好吧，我为你选择了另一个有用的短语。

segments.en: And it is mix up.
Mix up.
Mix up.
Mix up.
There seems to be a mix up.
Before we talk about this phrase, let's listen to some examples of how it is used.
segments.cn: 在我们谈论这个短语之前，让我们听一些如何使用的例子。

segments.en: There was a mix up at the airport, and my bags were sent to Antarctica.
segments.cn: 机场发生了混淆，我的行李被送到了南极洲。

segments.en: I'm sorry, sir.
There's been a terrible mix up.
We've given you the wrong baby.
segments.cn: 我们给了你错误的婴儿。

segments.en: Okay, that was useful and funny.
segments.cn: 好吧，那很有用也很有趣。

segments.en: Yeah, that's the baby situation.
Oh my God, imagine that happening.
segments.cn: 哦，我的天，想象一下那种情况。

segments.en: Yeah, I know.
Well, guys, so a mix up is a confusion or a misunderstanding.
segments.cn: 好吧，伙计们，混淆是指困惑或误解。

segments.en: Exactly.
Well put.

segments.cn: 好吧，Marco，你有什么要告诉我们的吗？

segments.cn: 好的，下一个你应该注意的词是“超额预订”。

segments.en: Overbooked.
Overbooked.
Overbooked.
What does that mean?
So if a hotel or a flight is overbooked, it means that they are full.
segments.cn: 所以如果一家酒店或航班超额预订，意味着他们已经满了。

segments.en: They are more than full.
Right, so they cannot accept any more people.
segments.cn: 对，所以他们不能再接收更多的人。

segments.en: Exactly.
Okay, now why is this phrase useful?
segments.cn: 好吧，这个短语为什么有用？

segments.en: Because it happens all the time.
There's so many other situations where you can use this word or hear it from other native English speakers.
segments.cn: 还有很多其他情况下你可以使用这个词或听到其他以英语为母语的人说这个词。

segments.en: For example, a bus or a train can be overbooked.
segments.cn: 例如，公交车或火车也可能超额预订。

segments.en: Exactly, that's really common.
Okay, let's take a look at the last phrase for today, and that is complementary upgrade.
segments.cn: 好吧，让我们看看今天最后一个短语，那就是“免费升级”。

segments.en: Complementary upgrade.
Complementary upgrade.
Complementary upgrade.
So this means that, for example, when the hotel is overbooked and all of their standard rooms are full, they will give you a better room, a more expensive room, but free.
segments.cn: 这意味着，例如，当酒店超额预订且所有标准房间都满时，他们会给你一个更好的房间，一个更贵的房间，但免费。

segments.en: Yes, because it was not your fault.
segments.cn: 是的，因为这不是你的错。

segments.en: Right, this also happens sometimes, if you're lucky, on airplane flights.
segments.cn: 对，这有时也会发生，如果你幸运的话，在飞机航班上。

segments.en: Yes.
So if you are an economy class and an airplane, but for some reason it's overbooked, they will move you to business class or first class for free.
segments.cn: 所以如果你是经济舱，但由于某种原因超额预订，他们会把你免费转到商务舱或头等舱。

segments.en: I have a similar story, but I'm not going to tell you about it now.
segments.cn: 我有一个类似的故事，但我现在不打算告诉你。
